name: Agricultural Development Corporation
description: Promote The Production Of Kenya’s Essential Agricultural Inputs

name: Agricultural Finance Corporation
description: To provide sustainable financing through participative and collaborative financial and non-financial interventions, innovations, technology and products

name: Agricultural Information Resource Centre (AIRC)
description: The Agricultural Information Resource Centre (AIRC), established in 1966 under the Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock Development, provides agricultural information services, capacity building, and knowledge-sharing platforms for farmers and stakeholders. It documents, produces, and disseminates technical content, collaborates with agencies on value chains and TIMPS, and offers training in ICT and knowledge management. AIRC also hosts the Ministry's main library and uses various media, including radio, to share success stories and promote agricultural innovations.

name: Agriculture And Food Authority (AFA)
description: To sustainably develop and promote scheduled crops value chains through effective regulation for economic growth

name: Agro-Chemical and Food Company
description: To Manufacture Yeast for Baking confectionary, Food Grade Extra Neutral Alcohol for Alcohol Beverages, Rectified and Denatured Spirits, Bottling and Packaging of Spirit and Manufacture of Carbon Dioxide

name: Alupe University
description: To Create, Evaluate, Apply, Preserve and Share Knowledge in a Free, Open and Inclusive Environment of Intellectual Inquiry for the Betterment of Society

name: Anti Female Genital Mutilation Board
description: To uphold the dignity and empowerment of girls and women in Kenya through coordination of initiatives, awareness creation and advocacy against FGM.

name: Anti-Counterfeit Authority (ACA)
description:
ACA is the lead Kenyan government agency tasked with prohibiting trade in counterfeit goods in the country. It was established by the Anti-Counterfeit Act 2008, and operationalized in June 2010 as a state corporation; currently under the Ministry of Investment, Trade, and Industry.



The Authority is mandated to the enlighten and inform the public on matters relating to counterfeiting, combat counterfeiting, trade and other dealings in counterfeit goods, devise and promote training programs to combat counterfeiting and co-ordinate with national, regional or international organizations involved in combating counterfeiting.

name: Anti-Money Laundering Advisory Board
description: The Anti-Money Laundering Advisory Board (AML Board) is established under section 49 of POCAMLA. The Board’s mandate under the Act is to advise the Director General of the Financial Reporting Centre (FRC) generally on the performance of his functions and the exercise of his powers under the Act.

name: Assets Recovery Agency
description: Dedicated platform for Anonymously reporting proceeds of crime.

name: Athi Water Works Development Agency
description: Athi Water Works Development Agency (AWWDA) is one of the nine (9) Water Works Development Agencies (WWDA) established under the Ministry of Water, Sanitation & Irrigation. It was established under the Water Act 2016 vide Legal Notice No. 28 of 26th April 2019.  The Agency is responsible for the development, maintenance and management of water and sewerage infrastructure in the counties of Nairobi, Kiambu and Muranga Counties covering 5,800.4Km2 with a total population of 9,320,287 people.

name: Betting Control And Licensing Board
description: Gain convenient access to our online betting and gambling regulatory services, ensuring fairness and transparency.

name: Board of Registration of Architects and Quantity Surveyors of Kenya (BORAQS)
description:
The Board’s mandate is to regulate the professions of Architecture and Quantity Surveying
through training, registration and enhancement of ethical practice.

name: Boma Yangu
description: The Boma Yangu platform is the gateway into the Affordable Housing Program. Start your journey towards home ownership.

name: Bomas of Kenya
description: BOMAS of Kenya was started by the Government of Kenya in 1971 as wholly owned subsidiary of the Tourism Finance Corporation (TFC) the Company was established to Preserve, Maintain and Promote the Rich Diverse cultural values of various ethnic groups of Kenya and to act as a tourist attraction centre thus Bomas of Kenya is expected to preserve the authenticity of the Kenya’s Cultural values and to portray them in the pure form

name: Bomet University College
description: Bomet University College is a Constituent College of Moi University established under a Legal Notice Number 145 of 27th July 2017. It is the first public university in Bomet County, strategically placed at the heart of Bomet Town. Its establishment aligns with the government's policy to establish at least one university in every county.

name: Bukura Agricultural College
description: To provide Agricultural Training through the integration of Research and Extension

name: Business Registration Services
description: Leverage BRS's digital platform for simplified and efficient business registration procedures.

name: Capital Markets Authority
description: Capital Markets Authority is a regulator of Capital and Commodity Markets in Kenya.

name: Centre for Mathematics, Science, and Technology Education in Africa (CEMASTEA
description: The Centre’s core mandate is capacity development in Pedagogical Content Knowledge (PCK) and ICT integration in STEM education for teachers in Basic education. Other programmes include STEM & Robotics Boot Camps and Outreaches, Science and Innovation fairs, Education for Sustainable Development (ESD), Climate Change, Inclusive and Gender Responsive trainings. The Centre also promotes partnerships and linkages in STEM Education.

name: Chemelil Sugar Company Limited
description: Chemelil Sugar Company Limited is mandated to Manufacture sugar and co-products from sugarcane and Establish and manage sugarcane plantations and assist others to do so.

name: Chuka University
description: To provide access, generate, preserve and share knowledge for quality, effective and ethical leadership in higher education, training, research and outreach through nurturing an intellectual culture that integrates theory with practice, innovation and entrepreneurship.

name: Civil Registration Services
description: Access CRS's online platform to conveniently apply and pay for birth and death registration services.

name: Clinical Officers Council of Kenya
description:
CLINICAL OFFICERS COUNCIL mandate is to regulate training,
registration, licensing and practice of all Clinical officers. COC works
to ensure that the Clinical Officers are trained to address Kenyans’ health
needs and deliver high quality health services.

name: Commission For University Education
description: Access CUE's online services for recognition, accreditation, quality audit, licensing, and collaboration.

name: Commission on Administrative Justice
description: The Commission on Administrative Justice Complaints Management Information System (CMIS) is a digital platform designed to streamline and enhance efficiency in the reporting and management of public complaints on maladministration.

name: Commodities Fund
description: Commodities Fund is a Kenyan Government agency, established by Crops Act 2013 under the Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock, Fisheries & Cooperatives to provide sustainable and affordable credit and advances for farm improvement; farm inputs; farming operations; agricultural Infrastructure development, equipment and to support processing initiatives.

name: Communications Authority Of Kenya
description: The Communications Authority of Kenya (CA) is the regulatory authority for the communications sector in Kenya. the Authority is responsible for facilitating the development of the information and communications sectors including; broadcasting, cybersecurity, multimedia, telecommunications, electronic commerce, postal and courier services.

name: Competition Authority Of Kenya
description: Competitive markets increase the prosperity and welfare of Kenyan consumers. Our role is to protect, strengthen and supplement the way competition works in Kenya markets and industries to improve the efficiency of the economy and to increase the welfare of Kenyans

name: Council of Legal Education
description: Promoting legal education and training, and the maintenance of the highest possible standards in legal education providers; and the provision of a system to guarantee the quality of legal education and legal education providers.

name: Counsellors and Psychologists Board
description: The counselors and Psychologists Board seeks to protect individuals and communities' mental health by promoting professional standards, supporting continuous professional growth, and offering ethical guidance leading to competency in counseling and psychological practice.

name: Dairy Training Institute
description: The institute draws her mandate from Executive Order No. 1 of 2023 and the 4th schedule of Kenyan Constitution under the State Department for Livestock Development that include capacity building and technical assistance to counties. The mission of the institute is to provide quality training, research, consultancy and outreach services in dairy production

name: Dedan Kimathi University of Technology
description: To provide academically stimulating, culturally diverse and quality learning environment that fosters research, innovation and technology development towards producing relevant technical and managerial human resource and leaders to contribute to attainment of national development goals.

name: Directorate of Criminal Investigations
description: Access the Directorate of Criminal Investigations' online platform for police clearance certificate services and more.

name: Directorate of Immigration Services (New Applications)
description: Utilize DIS's online services for efficient ePassport, temporary permit, and eVisa applications.

name: Directorate of Occupational Safety and Health Services
description: To promote a safe and healthy workplace by implementing effective systems for the prevention of Occupational diseases, ill health, accidents, and property damage to reduce the cost of production and improve productivity in all sectors of our economic activities.

name: Directorate of Veterinary Services
description: To safeguard animal and human health, improve animal welfare, increase animal resource productivity and ensure safe and high quality animals and their products to facilitate food security and domestic and international trade

name: Egerton University
description: Advancement of knowledge through teaching, scholarly research and scientific investigation.

name: Energy And Petroleum Regulatory Authority
description: Access EPRA’s online services for application and renewal of licenses and permits in the energy sector.

name: Engineers Board Of Kenya
description: Access EBKs online services for application and renewal of engineering licenses

name: Equalization Fund
description: The mandate is to provide basic services to the marginalised areas.

name: Estate Agents Registration Board (EARB)
description:
Estate Agents Registration Board (EARB) is the regulatory body for estate agency practice in Kenya and it
derives its mandate from Estate Agents Act, 1984 Cap 533 which was operationalized in 1987

name: Export Processing Zones Authority
description:
The Export Processing Zones Authority (EPZA) is a State Corporation under the Ministry of Investments, Trade & Industry (MITI), established in 1990 by the EPZ Act CAP 517, Laws of Kenya
Development of all aspects of the Export Processing Zones (EPZ) with particular emphasis on the provision of advice on the removal of impediments to, and creation of incentives for, export-oriented production in areas designated as export processing zones;

name: Financial Reporting Centre(FRC
description: The Financial Reporting Centre(FRC) is established by section 23 of the Proceeds of Crime and Anti-Money Laundering Act, 2009 with the principal objective of identifying the proceeds of crime, combating money laundering, countering the financing of terrorism and the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction.

name: Firearms Licensing Board
description: Resposible for regulating, licensing and controlling the manufacture, importation, exportation, transportation, sale, repair, storage, possession and use of firearms.

name: Garissa University
description: To nurture talent through research, innovation, consultancy, community outreach, entrepreneurship, imparting knowledge and skills to meet the needs of the society.

name: Government Chemist
description: To provide Forensic Science and Analytical Laboratory services to Government Institutions, private sector and the public for the purpose of safeguarding human health, environment and administration of justice.

name: Government Human Resource Information System (GHRS)
description: The Government Human Resource Information System (GHRIS) is a Human Resource Information System (HRIS) developed by the Government of Kenya.It to provide a One-Stop-Shop HRIS for management of all Human Resource (HR) aspects in Government. It is aimed at providing a “from entry to post exit” centralized, web based, self-service information system for HR managers and individual employees

name: Government Performance Contracting Information System
description: Platform fully automating end-to-end Performance Management System - with all processes being carried out online. Processes entails PC preparation. PC negotiation, vetting, midyear review, evaluation and ranking

name: Government Press
description: The Government Press is a Department under the Executive Office of the President as per the Executive Order No. 1 of 2023. It is Kenya's major centralized facility for creating, verifying, distributing, and archiving official Government information. It is a long-standing printing establishment, responsible for printing and publishing official Government documents like laws of Kenya, the Kenya Gazette and its subsidiary legislations, government accountable documents for revenue collection

name: Higher Education Loans Board (HELB)
description: Repay HELB loan, get compliance and clearance certificates after completion.

name: Huduma Kenya Service Delivery Program(HKSDP)
description:
The Huduma Kenya Service Delivery Programme has the mandate to transform
Public Service Delivery in order to ensure access to efficient, effective and citizen-centric
services through One-Stop-Shop platforms.

name: Human Resource Management Professionals Examinations Board
description: Human Resource Management Professionals Examinations Board (HRMPEB) is a state corporation established by section 16 of the Human Resource Management Professionals Act, no. 52, 2012 as an examinations body, mandated to develop and review curricula, examine and certify Human Resource Professionals

name: Independent Policing Oversight Authority
description: To conduct impartial and independent investigations, inspections, audits and monitoring of the National Police Service to prevent impunity and enhance professionalism in the interest of the public

name: Institute Of Certified Investment And Financial Analysts
description: Regulate the Investment and Financial Analysis profession in Kenya and  to register and grant practising certificates to Certified Investment and Financial Analysts (CIFAs) in Kenya both in private and public practice under the Investment and Financial Analysts Act (No.13 of 2015).

name: Institute Of Certified Public Secretaries Of Kenya (ICPSK)
description: The Institute of Certified Secretaries of Kenya (ICS) is the professional organization for Certified Secretaries.

name: Insurance Regulatory Authority
description: The Authority's mandate is to regulate, supervise and develop the insurance industry in Kenya.

name: Intergovernmental Relations Technical Committee
description:
To support successful devolution through cooperative, consultative and
coordinated intergovernmental relations

name: Jaramogi Oginga Odinga Teaching & Referral Hospital (JOOTRH)
description: Jaramogi Oginga Odinga Teaching & Referral Hospital (JOOTRH) is a major public health facility in Kisumu, Kenya, serving as a teaching hospital and referral center for the western region. It offers specialized medical services, advanced diagnostics, and training for healthcare professionals.

name: Jaramogi Oginga Odinga University of Science and Technology
description: To provide quality University education that nurtures creativity and innovation through integrated training, research and community outreach for sustainable development.

name: Jomo Kenyatta Foundation
description: The Jomo Kenyatta Foundation is a parastatal under the Ministry of Education, with a mandate of awarding scholarships to bright but needy students to secondary school.

name: Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture and Technology
description: To offer accessible quality training, research, innovation and entrepreneurship in order to produce leaders in the fields of Agriculture, Engineering, Technology, Enterprise Development, Built Environment, Health Sciences, Social Sciences and other Applied Sciences to suit the needs of a dynamic world.

name: KENYA FISHERIES SERVICE
description: The mandate of the Kenya Fisheries Service as per the Fisheries Management and Development Act, No. 35 of 2016 is to Conserve, Manage and Develop Kenya’s Fisheries and Aquaculture resources.

name: KENYA HEALTH PROFESSIONS OVERSIGHT AUTHORITY (KHPOA)
description:
To provide oversight in the regulation of health care services; training, registration
and licensing of health professionals; coordinate joint health inspections; receive
and facilitate resolution of complaints and arbitrate disputes/conflicts; ensure
compliance of health professionals standards and monitor execution of respective
mandates and functions of health regulatory bodies.

name: Kaimosi Friends University
description: To provide quality education and training, research and innovation to meet the needs of a dynamic Society

name: Karatina university
description: Karatina University is a public chartered institution of higher learning as provided for in the Universities Act of 2012, domiciled in Kenya - Nyeri County. It is located 140km North of Nairobi (0039’S37014’E) and 15km from Karatina town, off the Nairobi-Nyeri highway, in an area rich in agricultural soils and endowed with vast natural resources. The mandate of Karatina University is to conserve, create and disseminate knowledge through training, research, innovation and community outreach.

name: Kenya Academy of Sports
description:
To develop sports talent through establishment and management of sports academies,
training and research for global competitiveness and sustainable socio-economic growth

name: Kenya Accreditation Service
description: Kenya Accreditation Service provides greater confidence in accredited conformity assessment services to business, government regulators, consumers and the public.

name: Kenya Agriculture and Livestock Research Organisation (KALRO)
description: Promote, streamline, coordinate, and regulate research in crops, livestock, genetic resources, and biotechnology and Expedite equitable access to research information, resources, technology and promote the application of the research findings and technology in the field of agriculture.

name: Kenya Airports Authority
description: To provide consistent and delightful travel experience

name: Kenya Animal Genetic Resources Centre
description: The Centre has the mandate to produce, preserve, and conserve animal genetic materials (semen embryos, tissues, and live animals) and rear breeding sires for the provision of high-quality disease-free semen to meet the national demand and for export.

name: Kenya Anti Doping Agency
description: To lead a coordinated national anti-doping education and awareness campaign, testing and promotion of integrity for doping-free sport

name: Kenya Biovax Institute
description: The mandate of the Kenya BioVax Institute (KBI) is to manufacture human vaccines and other routine and emergency vaccines to serve the people of Kenya and beyond,  to manufacture other biomedical products including, among others, biosimilar anti-cancers, snake anti-venoms, insulin, medical infusions, and other biomedical products that can use the same platform as that of production of vaccines, to manufacture pharmaceutical diagnostics and health products and technologies (HPTs) including rapid diagnostic test kits, assistive devices and specialized HPTs for cancer and gene therapy, to support technology transfer and commercialization of research outputs from research institutions, colleges, and universities; and to support local pharmaceutical industries in development and production of quality and affordable products.

name: Kenya Broadcasting Corporation(KBC)
description: To provide leadership in transmission of objective, informative, educative and entertaining content to the public through high quality broadcasts.

name: Kenya Building Research Centre (KBRC)
description:
KBRC’s mandate is to coordinate
Building Research Services in the Building Industry, intending to promote research in
building to reduce the construction cost. Kenya Building Research Centre has been a critical
player in providing vital information on innovative building solutions in support of the
affordable housing program, which is one of the transformation agendas of the government

name: Kenya Bureau of Standards (KEBS)
description: The Kenya Bureau of Standards (KEBS) has remained the premier government agency for the provision of Standards, Metrology and Conformity Assessment (SMCA) services since its inception in 1974. Over that period its main activities have grown from the development of standards and quality control for a limited number of locally made products in the 1970s to the provision of more comprehensive Standards development, Metrology, Conformity Assessment, Training and Certification services. With the re-establishment of the East African Community (EAC) and Common Market for Eastern and Southern Africa (COMESA), KEBS activities now include participation in the development and implementation of SMCA activities at the regional level where it participates in the harmonization of standards, measurements and conformity assessment regimes for regional integration. KEBS operates the National Enquiry Point in support of the WTO Agreement on Technical Barriers to Trade (TBT).

name: Kenya Civil Aviation Authority
description:
To plan, develop, manage, regulate and operate a safe, economically sustainable and efficient civil
aviation system in Kenya, in accordance with the provisions of the Civil Aviation Act, 2013

name: Kenya Cultural Centre
description: The Kenya Cultural Centre (KCC) is a State Corporation established through an Act of Parliament Cap 218 under the Ministry of Youth Affairs, the Arts and Sports. We are dedicated to the preservation of Kenya's rich cultural heritage and history, ensuring their transmission to generations to come. This noble endeavour is realized through a Centre that nurtures artistic expression, catering to both performing and visual artists.

name: Kenya Dairy Board
description: Kenya Dairy Board is a state corporation under the Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock Development established through an Act of Parliament, CAP 336 of the Laws of Kenya. The mandate of the Board is to provide for the improvement and control of the dairy industry and its products. The Board ensures safety and quality of dairy products through issuance of regulatory permits and inspection of Dairy Business premises.

name: Kenya Deposit Insurance Corporation
description: KDIC is a statutory institution established under the Kenya Deposit Insurance Act, 2012 (KDI Act, 2012). The Corporation is mandated to provide a deposit insurance scheme for customers of member institutions, to provide incentives for sound risk management and generally promote the stability of the financial system and prompt resolution

name: Kenya Development Corporation (KDC)
description: KDC is mandated to play a catalytic role in Kenya’s socio-economic development by providing long-term financing and other financial, investment and business advisory services. Therefore, KDC plays an important role in addressing critical gaps for long-term funding that cannot be met by commercial banks in target sectors in Kenya and elsewhere.

name: Kenya Development Response to Displacement Impacts Project (KDRDIP)
description: Kenya Development Response to Displacement Impacts Project (KDRDIP) is a National Government initiative, supported by the World Bank to improve the lives of the refugee-hosting communities in the north of the country. It is a Community Driven Development (CDD) where communities identify, plan, implement, monitor and sustain their development projects

name: Kenya Education Management Institute
description: Kenya Education Management Institute (KEMI) is mandated under Legal Notice No.19/2010 to provide management training, conduct research and offer consultancy services to both public and private sectors

name: Kenya Engineering Technology Registration Board
description:
The Kenya Engineering Technology Registration Board (KETRB) is a state corporation
established under section 3(1) of the Engineering Technology Act, No.23 of 2016.
The Act mandates the Board to regulate the practice and set standards for
engineering technologists and technicians including craft-persons and artisans.

name: Kenya Film Classification Board
description: Access KFCB's online services to regulate film and broadcast content distribution.

name: Kenya Film Commission
description: Committed to developing an enabling environment for filmmakers and film industry facilitation

name: Kenya Fishing Industries Corporation
description: The Kenya Fishing Industries Corporation’s mandate is to exploit fishery resources in the Kenya fishery waters and high seas by promoting establishment and efficiency of businesses engaged in the fishing and fishing related activities.

name: Kenya Forest Service
description: The Service is mandated to conserve, develop and sustainably manage forests and allied resources for environmental stability and the social-economic development of the people of Kenya.

name: Kenya Forestry Research Institute
description: KEFRI conducts research in forestry and allied natural resources, Disseminate research findings to stakeholders, Build capacity of stakeholders and Establish partnerships and cooperate with other research organizations and institutions of higher learning in joint research and training.

name: Kenya Industrial Estates (KIE)
description:
Kenya Industrial Estates (KIE) is a government parastatal and development finance institution
under the Ministry of Co-operatives and MSME Development. It supports the growth of Micro,
Small, and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) across Kenya through industrial clustering, value
addition, and entrepreneurship development. KIE provides affordable medium and long-term
financing, business advisory services, and SME incubation programs in priority sectors like agro-
processing, textiles, and metal fabrication. With 37 branches and SME Parks nationwide, KIE
also facilitates technology transfer, market access, and rural industrialization, playing a critical
role in Kenya’s Vision 2030 and the Big Four Agenda.

name: Kenya Industrial Property Institute
description: The Institute is charged with administration of Industrial Property Rights; Provision of Technological Information to the public; Promoting Inventiveness in Kenya and Provision of Training on Industrial Property.

name: Kenya Industrial Research and Development Institute (KIRDI)
description: KIRDI is a public research institution under the Ministry of Investments, Trade and Industry. The mandate of the Institute is to undertake research, development and innovation in industrial and allied technologies and to disseminate the research findings to support industrial development.

name: Kenya Institute For Public Policy Research And Analysis (KIPPRA)
description: To provide quality public policy advice to the Government of Kenya by conducting objective research and analysis and through capacity building in order to contribute to the achievement of national development goals.

name: Kenya Institute Of Business Training (KIBT)
description: To provide Business and Management Development Services to MSMEs and other Interest Groups through: Training, Research, Consultancy, Counseling, Extension Services and Business Information for improved performance

name: Kenya Institute Of Primate Research (KIPRE)
description: To improve human health and biodiversity through advances in basic and preclinical biomedical research and non-human primate conservation.

name: Kenya Institute Of Supplies Examination Board
description: Kenya Institute of Supplies Examination Board (KISEB) is a professional examination body with the mandate to develop syllabuses, conduct examinations for professional supply chain management certification.

name: Kenya Institute for the Blind
description: Ensuring a fair, safe, and inclusive environment for the well-being of visually impaired Kenyans.

name: Kenya Institute of Curriculum Development (KICD)
description: The Kenya Institute of Curriculum Development (KICD) was established by the Government of Kenya on the 14th of January 2013 under an Act of Parliament- It also evaluates vets and approves the curricular and curriculum support materials for basic and tertiary education, as well as offering curriculum based consultancy services in basic and tertiary education and training.

name: Kenya Institute of Mass Communication (KIMC)
description: The Kenya Institute of Mass Communication (KIMC) is a public media training institution under the Ministry of Information, Communications and Digital Economy. It was established in 1961 with a core mandate in media and communication training at middle level for both public and private sector. It has a strong emphasis on practical hands - on training aimed at meeting the great demand in the ever-changing technology industry

name: Kenya Institute of Special Education
description: Kenya Institute of Special Education (KISE) is a semi-autonomous government agency of the Ministry of Education, Kenya. It was established through a Legal Notice No. 17 of 14th February 1986. Our goal is to ensure that every child with special needs and disability accesses quality education and achieves their full potential.

name: Kenya Institute of Supplies Management (KISM)
description: The Kenya Institute of Supplies Management is a body corporate established under Section 3 of the “Supplies Practitioners Management Act, 2007”. The mandate of KISM is to, amongst others, make provision for the training, registration, and licensing of supplies practitioners; to regulate their practice and for connected purposes.

name: Kenya Investment Authority
description:
Kenya Investment Authority (KenInvest) is a statutory body established in 2004
and currently operating through an Act of Parliament (Investment Promotion Act
No. 6 of 2004) with the main objective of promoting investments in Kenya. It is
responsible for facilitating the implementation of new investment projects,
providing After Care services for new and existing investments, as well as
organizing investment promotion activities both locally and internationally

name: Kenya Law Reform Commission
description: To facilitate law reform conducive to social, economic and political development

name: Kenya Leather Development Council
description: Kenya Leather Development Council (KLDC) is a State Corporation established by the Government of Kenya under the Kenya Leather Development Council Order, 2011 (Legal Notice No. 114 of 9th September, 2011), under the State Corporations Act (Cap.446), Laws of Kenya. The Council was instituted as a Specialized agency to drive the Government’s agenda on the development leather industry. To achieve this, the Council is expected to regulate and facilitate the growth of the industry.

name: Kenya Literature Bureau
description: Access, purchase and download quality Kenya Literature Bureau e-books.

name: Kenya Marine and Fisheries Research Institute
description: KMFRI's mandate is to undertake research in "marine and freshwater fisheries, aquaculture, environmental and ecological studies, and marine research including chemical and physical oceanography", in order to provide scientific data and information for sustainable development of the Blue Economy.

name: Kenya Maritime Authority
description: Access permits and licenses via the Kenya Maritime Authority's new online service portal.

name: Kenya Meat Commission
description: To procure, process and market high quality meat and meat products at competitive prices using efficient, effective and environmentally friendly systems to the satisfaction of customers and other stakeholders

name: Kenya Medical Laboratory Technicians and Technologists Board
description: KMLTTB strives to ensure that medical services in the country are regulated and aligned to the global emerging trends in an effort to provide the highest quality medical services to Kenyans without compromise.

name: Kenya Medical Practitioners And Dentists Council
description: To regulate the training, practice and licensing of medicine & dentistry and healthcare institutions that include private & mission hospitals, medical, dental centers & clinics, nursing and maternity homes and standalone funeral homes

name: Kenya Medical Research Institute(KEMRI)
description: Explore Kemri's online services to access health research, innovation and capacity building.

name: Kenya Medical Supplies Authority(KEMSA)
description: Procure, Warehouse and Distribute Health Products and Technologies

name: Kenya Medical Training College
description: To produce competent health professionals through training and research, and provide consultancy services

name: Kenya Meteorological Department
description: Providing weather and climate Information services for sustainable development

name: Kenya National Archives and Documentation Service
description: Preserving valuable public records as part of the documentary heritage of the Republic of Kenya.

name: Kenya National Bureau of Statistics
description: To provide, manage and promote quality statistical services through utilization of best practices for evidence-based decision making

name: Kenya National Commission for UNESCO
description:
The Commission mobilizes financial, technical, and informational resources from UNESCO;
promotes collaborations between national and international institutions; promotes knowledge
and information sharing; facilitates national and international policy formulation in the fields
of Education, Sciences, Culture, and Communication & Information among other functions.

name: Kenya National Entreprenuers Savings Trust(Knest)
description:
The Kenya National Entrepreneurs Savings Trust (KNEST) is a unique National Informal Sector Scheme designed
to meet the unique diverse needs of the marginalized informal Sector workers who have traditionally been excluded from the existing formal pensions and savings arrangements

name: Kenya National Examination Council (KNEC)
description: Set and maintain examinations standards

name: Kenya National Highway Authority(KeNHA)
description:
The Kenya National Highways Authority (KeNHA) is a statutory body established under the Kenya Roads Act of 2007 and inaugurated in September 2008.
KeNHA is responsible for the development, rehabilitation, management and maintenance of all National Trunk Roads comprising of Class S, A, and B roads.

name: Kenya National Innovation Agency
description: The Kenya National Innovation Agency (KeNIA) is a State Corporation established under the Science, Technology and Innovation (STI) Act, No. 28 of 2013 under the Ministry of Education. The core mandate of the Agency is to develop and manage the National Innovation System. The Agency is therefore responsible for co-ordination, promotion and regulation of the National Innovation System.

name: Kenya National Library Services
description:
Preserving the national documentary heritage and enabling access to information
and knowledge

name: Kenya National Public Health Institute (NPHI)
description: The Institute was established to consolidate and coordinate key activities in public health, including prevention, early detection of public health emergencies, and events of concern. The institute's mandate is to strengthen and promote public health issues by providing a centralized platform for managing and responding to outbreaks and emergencies at various levels, from national to community

name: Kenya National Qualifications Authority
description: Kenya National Qualifications Authority accepts online applications of academic qualifications for alignment into the Kenya National Qualifications Framework(KNQF) according to the level descriptors and validation from both Kenyans and Foreigners through this platform

name: Kenya National Shipping Line Ltd
description: To provide competitive shipping and logistics services and safeguard national aspirations in facilitating global trade

name: Kenya National Trading Corporation
description: The Kenya National Trading Corporation Ltd is a State Corporation in the Ministry of Industry, Trade & Investment, mandated to act as a procurement agent for the government and participate in the promotion of wholesale and retail trade in order to strengthen the supply chain of essential products within the country.

name: Kenya News Agency
description: Provide information to citizens to make informed decisions.

name: Kenya Nuclear Regulatory Authority
description: Kenya Nuclear Regulatory Authority (KNRA) is a public entity established under Section 5 of the Nuclear Regulatory Act No. 29 of 2019, which commenced on 10th January 2020, to provide protection of persons, property and the environment against the harmful effects of ionizing and non-ionizing radiation through the establishment of a system of regulatory control.

name: Kenya Plant Health Inspectorate Services
description: Kenya Plant Health Inspectorate Service (KEPHIS) is the government parastatal whose responsibility is to assure the quality of agricultural inputs and produce to prevent adverse impacts on the economy, the environment, and human health.

name: Kenya Ports Authority
description: ​​The Kenya Ports Authority’s mandate is to maintain, operate, improve and regulate all sea and inland waterway ports in Kenya.

name: Kenya Power and Lighting Company(KPLC)
description: Take advantage of our convenient online services for Electricity Applications, Accessing Bill Statements, Registering Complaints, Making Payments and many more.

name: Kenya Railways Corporation
description: The core mandates of the corporation are to provide efficient and effective rail and inland waterways transport.

name: Kenya Revenue Authority
description: To enhance mobilisation of government revenue and to facilitate growth in economic activities and trade by ensuring compliance with tax and customs laws

name: Kenya Rural Roads Authority
description: KeRRA is a State Corporation within the State Department of Infrastructure under the Ministry of Transport, Infrastructure, Housing and Urban Development and established through the Kenya Roads Act, 2007.

name: Kenya School Of Agriculture
description: Kenya School of Agriculture is a tertiary agricultural training institution under the Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock Development. Established in 2011, it succeeded Embu Agricultural Staff Training (EAST) College through a Gazette Notice Number 65 on June 17, 2011. The school is currently located at Wambugu Farm in Nyeri County.

name: Kenya School Of Government
description: To contribute to the transformation of public services by inculating national values and developing core skills and competencies for quality service delivery

name: Kenya School Of Law
description: To provide professional legal education and training through the Advocates and Paralegal Training Programs, and promote continuing legal education for advocates in Kenya and beyond.

name: Kenya School of Adventure and Leadership
description: Enhancing leadership, team building skills, personal development and environment awareness through experiential training.

name: Kenya School of TVET
description:
Kenya School of TVET (KSTVET) formerly Kenya Technical Trainers College (KTTC) is a Government
Institution under the Ministry of Education established with the primary objective of training
Technical Trainers to teach in Technical, Vocational Education and Training (TVET) institutions, and
be employed in all sectors of the economy.

name: Kenya Seed Company Ltd
description: To avail sufficient certified seeds competitively through research and development to the satisfaction of stakeholders

name: Kenya Shipyards Limited
description: Kenya Shipyards Limited (KSL) was incorporated on 29 September 2020 with a mandate to lead and catalyse the introduction of shipbuilding industry in Eastern Africa with a focus on meeting the local demand from Kenya Navy, Ministries Departments and Agencies (MDAs) with maritime assets and other public and private domestic and regional clients.

name: Kenya Space Agency
description: The Agency is a State Corporation under the Ministry of Defence mandated to promote, coordinate and regulate space-related activities to enhance utilization of space technology for national socio economic development.

name: Kenya Tissue and Transplant Authority
description: The Kenya Tissue and Transplant Authority is established under Section 3 of the State Corporations Act Cap 446 vide legal Notice 142 of 2022. KTTA is mandated to coordinate, oversee and ensure access to safe blood, blood transfusion and Transplant Services in Kenya.

name: Kenya Tourism Board
description: Develop, implement and co-ordinate a National Tourism marketing strategy

name: Kenya Trade Network Agency (KENTRADE)
description: Kenya Trade Network Agency provides access to imports and exports clearance through the National Electronic Single Window System

name: Kenya Tsetse and Trypanosomiasis Eradication Council (KENTTEC)
description: Kenya Tsetse and Trypanosomiasis Eradication Council (KENTTEC) is a state Corporation mandated to coordinate all Tsetse and Trypanosomiasis eradication activities in Kenya. The Council was gazetted by Government of Kenya through a gazette legal notice no. 77 of July 2012 as a successor to the Pan-African Tsetse and Trypanosomiasis Eradication Campaign.

name: Kenya Universities and Colleges Placement Service
description:
he Kenya Universities and Colleges Central Placement Service (KUCCPS) is a State
Corporation that provides career guidance and selects students for admission to universities,
national polytechnics, technical training institutes and other accredited higher learning
institutions for Government of Kenya-sponsored programmes

name: Kenya Urban Roads Authority
description: Managing, Developing, Rehabilitating and Maintaining the National Urban Trunk Roads

name: Kenya Utalii College
description: To be a globally recognized and transformative premier tourism and hospitality training center.

name: Kenya Veterinary Board
description: Our mandate is to exercise general supervision and control over the training, business, practice and employment of veterinary surgeons and veterinary paraprofessionals in Kenya and advise the government in relation to all aspects thereof.

name: Kenya Veterinary Vaccine Production Institute
description: Producing safe, Quality and Affordable Veterinary Vaccines for Improvement of the Livestock Industry.

name: Kenya Vision 2030 Delivery Secretariat
description: To provide strategic leadership and coordination in the implementation of the Vision as the country's blueprint and strategy towards making Kenya a newly industrializing upper middle-income, globally competitive, and prosperous country providing high quality of life for all its citizens in a clean and secure environment by the year 2030.

name: Kenya Water Institute
description: KEWI, as established by the KEWI Act 2001 is mandated to offer training, administer examinations, and offer research and consultancy services in the wider water sector. The Act also mandates the institute to provide a forum for effective collaboration between the public and private sectors and other interested parties to develop the water and sanitation sectors.

name: Kenya Wildlife Research and Training Institute
description: To conduct and coordinate wildlife research and training through innovative approaches to enable the provision of accurate data and information to stakeholders for decision-making.

name: Kenya Wildlife Service
description:
Explore. Experience.  Conserve.
Kenya Parks

name: Kenya Year Book Editorial Board
description: Kenya Yearbook Editorial Board enhances government communication by disseminating credible information page by page, on projects, initiatives and developments that positively change the lives of citizens.

name: Kenyatta International Convention Center (KICC)
description: The Kenyatta International Convention Centre (KICC) is a State Corporation established under the Tourism Act 2011 whose objective and purpose is to promote the business of Meetings, Incentive Travel, Conferences and Exhibitions also known as MICE.

name: Kenyatta National Hospital
description: KNH offers quality specialized healthcare to patients from the Great Lakes Region, Southern and Central Africa. These services include open heart surgery, neurosurgery, orthopedics surgery, reconstructive surgery, burns management, critical care services, new born services, ophthalmology (cornea transplant), liver resections, oncology, palliative care and renal services (including kidney transplantation), among others

name: Kenyatta University
description: Providing high quality programs that attract individuals who wish to be globally competitive

name: Kenyatta University Teaching, Referral and Research Hospital
description: Kenyatta University Teaching, Referral & Research Hospital (KUTRRH) is a leading Public National Referral Hospital. with a 650-bed hospital equipped with state-of-the-art medical equipment. We employ cutting edge research, innovation, training, and partnerships to keep abreast with advancements in healthcare management.

name: Kibabii University
description: To achieve excellence in generation, transmission and enhancement of new knowledge in Science, Technology and Innovation through quality Teaching, Research, Training, Scholarship, Consultancy and Outreach Programmes.

name: Kirinyaga University
description: To train and develop human resources equipped with innovative skills to inspire enterprise in the disciplines of engineering, science, health and technology, to meet the demands of a dynamic world. Our courses are geared towards producing skilled manpower to create and occupy opportunities in the new dynamic world while addressing areas outlined by the Vision 2030 and beyond.

name: Kisii University
description: A world-class University in the advancement of academic excellence, research and social welfare aiming to train human resource that meets the development needs of the country and international labour market, sustaining the production of quality and relevant research, disseminate knowledge, skills, values and competencies for the advancement of humanity.

name: Koitaleel Samoei University College
description: Koitaleel Samoei University College (KSUC) was established in 2015 under the mentorship of the University of Nairobi. KSUC is therefore a creation of section 8 of the University of Nairobi Charter and section 42 of the Universities Act No. 42 of 2012. KSUC Main Campus is in Nandi Hills and Mosoriot Campus where it was formally Mosoriot Teachers Training College

name: Konza Technopolis Development Authority
description: Konza Technopolis is a flagship project under Kenya’s Vision 2030 that aims to transform the country into a newly industrializing middle-income country providing a high quality of life to all its citizens in a clean and secure environment.

name: LAPFUND
description: LAPFUND is a Defined Contribution Scheme registered and regulated by the Retirement Benefits Act of 1997 and Subsequent Regulations. We are a State Corporation established in 1960 by an Act of Parliament Cap. 272, Laws of Kenya. We operate in accordance with the County Governments Act 2012 (section 132).

name: Laikipia university
description: To contribute to the world through Education, Research, Training, Consultancy, Innovation, Outreach, and Collaboration.

name: Land Rent Refunds Section
description: Includes searching for a Title deed, land rent clearance demand notice and payments.

name: MOW Sports Club
description:
The MoW sports club is owned by the State Department of Public works and is located at
the heart of Kenya’s capital city, Nairobi. The Club is one of the oldest and most popular
recreational and sporting establishment in Kenya.

name: Maasai Mara University
description: Maasai Mara University is dedicated to delivering top-tier education, grounded in cutting-edge research and enhanced by global partnerships with industries and academic institutions. The university's areas of expertise encompass Business, Computing, ICT, Education, Psychology, Tourism, Environmental Sciences, and Health Sciences and Research. At the heart of our mission is the pursuit of knowledge and personal transformation. The university is a vibrant community of learners, and our aim is to provide insight into what distinguishes our institution: our unwavering commitment to academic excellence

name: Machakos University
description: Machakos University  is a vibrant premier higher education institution whose core mandate is to teach, train, conduct research, innovate, offer community service, generate new knowledge and facilitate technology transfer.

name: Mama Ngina University College
description: Mama Ngina University College is a constituent college of Kenyatta University located in Gatundu, Kiambu County. The university college offers a wide range of high-quality market-driven academic programmes with a major focus on Digital Technology and Primary Health Care.

name: Maseno University
description: To discover, harness, apply, disseminate and preserve knowledge for good of humanity

name: Masinde Muliro University of Science and Technology
description: To provide excellent university education, training and research through integrating science, technology and innovation into quality programmes to suit the needs of a dynamic world.

name: Mathari National Teaching and Referral Hospital
description: Mathari National Teaching and Referral Hospital (MNTRH) is Kenya’s leading mental health care facility (level 6). With 700 inpatient beds, we offer comprehensive mental health care, outpatient services, and rehabilitation. Our specialized services include psychiatric care, forensic psychiatry, and child and adolescent mental health care. MNTRH also engages in community outreach to raise mental health awareness and education

name: Media Council Of Kenya
description: The Media Council of Kenya is an independent national institution established by the Media Council Act, No. 46 of 2013 to set media standards and ensure compliance with those standards as envisaged in Article 34(5) of the Constitution.

name: Meru University
description: Mandate: A world-class University of excellence in Science and Technology aiming to provide quality University education, training and research in Science, Technology and innovation.

name: Micro And Small Entreprise Authority(MSEA)
description: The Authority plans to spark industrial revolution by undertaking policy reforms and implementing targeted programmes and activities in the MSE sector

name: Ministry for Water and Sanitation
description: Ministry of Water, Sanitation and Irrigation was established in the year 2023 through an Executive Order No. 1 of March, 2023. The mandate of the ministry is to promote and support integrated water resource management in Kenya.

name: Moi Teaching And Referral Hospital
description: is a Multi-Specialty National Teaching and Referral Hospital serving the Western half of Kenya (23 Counties with a population of over 25 million people, Eastern Uganda, Southern Sudan, Northern Tanzania, and Democratic Republic of Congo amongst other areas

name: Moi University
description: Experience hassle-free access to Moi University's online services from anywhere.

name: Multimedia University of Kenya
description: To provide quality training, nurture a culture of research, innovation and extension to meet the aspirations of a dynamic society.

name: Murang'a University of Technology
description:
To advance knowledge and technological transfer through teaching, training, learning, research, and
innovation for sustainable development.

name: NAIROBI CENTRE FOR INTERNATIONAL ARBITRATION
description: The Nairobi Centre for International Arbitration (NCIA) was established in 2013 by an Act of Parliament, the Nairobi Centre for International Arbitration Act No. 26 of 2013, as a Centre for promotion of international commercial arbitration and other forms of dispute resolution mechanisms. The NCIA offers a neutral venue for the conduct of international arbitration with commitment to providing institutional support to the arbitral process.

name: NATIONAL COUNCIL FOR POPULATION AND DEVELOPMENT
description: NCPD is a Semi-Autonomous Government Agency mandated with the responsibility of coordinating the implementation of population and development activities in Kenya.

name: NGO Coordination Board
description: The Non-Governmental Organizations Co-ordination Board is a State Corporation established by the Non-Governmental Organizations Co-ordination Act (Cap 19) of 1990. The Board has the responsibility of regulating and enabling the NGO sector in Kenya. The NGOs Co-ordination Board started its operations in 1992 and is currently under the Ministry of Interior and Co-ordination of National Government.

name: Nairobi Metropolitan Area Transport Authority (NaMATA)
description:
The Nairobi Metropolitan Area Transport Authority
(NaMATA) is mandated to oversee the establishment of an
integrated, efficient, effective and sustainable public
transport system within the Nairobi Metropolitan Area
(NMA).

name: National Assembly
description: The legislative authority of the Republic is derived from the people. Parliament may consider and pass amendments to the Constitution, Parliament shall protect this Constitution and promote the democratic governance of the Republic.

name: National Authority For The Campaign Against Alcohol And Drug Abuse (NACADA)
description: Access NACADA online services on the campaign against alcohol and drug abuse

name: National Biosafety Authority
description: The National Biosafety Authority (NBA) was established by the Biosafety Act No. 2 of 2009 to exercise general supervision and control over the transfer, handling and use of genetically modified organisms (GMOs). GMOs are products of Modern Biotechnology that involve the manipulation of the genetic material of organisms through genetic engineering procedures.

name: National Cereals and Produce Board
description: National Cereals and Produce Board (NCPB) is a commercial State Corporation under the Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock, Fisheries and Cooperatives. The Board’s mandate is to provide logistics support services to the government on food security matters and to carry out market intervention for grains and farm inputs on behalf of the government.

name: National Cereals and Produce Board (NCPB)
description: National Cereals and Produce Board: To promote food production, trade in agricultural products and provide premier warehousing.

name: National Cohesion and Integration Commission
description: The National Cohesion and Integration Commission complaints management system is a platform meant to streamline the reporting and handling of hate speech, ethnic contempt, ethnic discrimination in employment, and other related offenses.

name: National Commission for Science Technology and Innovation
description: The National Commission for Science, Technology and Innovation (NACOSTI) is a state corporation established under the Science, Technology and Innovation Act, 2013 (Revised 2014).  The mandate of the Commission is to regulate and assure quality in the science, technology and innovation sector and advise the Government in matters related thereto

name: National Construction Authority (NCA)
description: Dedicated platform for Registration of Contractors, Projects and Skilled Workers, Among Other Services

name: National Council for Law Reporting (Kenya Law)
description: The mandate of Kenya Law is to publish the judicial opinions of the superior courts of Kenya i.e. the Supreme Court, Court of Appeal and the High Court. NCLR is the designated publisher of the Kenya Law Reports.

name: National Council for Nomadic Education in Kenya (NACONEK)
description: National Council for Nomadic Education in Kenya (NACONEK) works to improve education access and quality in marginalized areas of Kenya. They develop policies, secure resources, coordinate efforts with other organizations, and set standards specifically suited to the needs of these communities

name: National Council for Persons with Disabilities(NCPWD)
description: To promote and protect equalization of opportunities and realization of human rights for PWDs to live descent livelihoods.

name: National Crime Research Centre
description:
The National Crime Research Centre (NCRC) is a State Corporation
under The Ministry of Interior and National Administration established
by an Act of Parliament, the National Crime Research Act 1997 CAP 62
Laws of Kenya. The Centre is mandated to carry out research into the
causes of crime, its prevention and to disseminate the research findings
and recommendations to Government Agencies concerned with the
administration of criminal justice, NCRC’s stakeholders and the public

name: National Defence University of Kenya
description: NDU-K was established under Section 24 of the Universities Education Act, 2012 on 27 May 2021. The University offers specialized certificates, diplomas and degrees in areas related to Defence and security, as well as other dimensions of security. The University is based at Lanet, Nakuru County

name: National Drought Management Authority
description: To provide leadership and coordination of Kenya's effort in the management of drought risks and enhancing adaptation to climate change

name: National Employment Authority
description: The National Employment Authority (NEA) provides for a comprehensive institutional framework for employment management; enhancement of employment promotion interventions; and increasing access to employment by the youth, minorities and marginalized groups

name: National Environment Trust Fund
description: We are a state corporation under the Ministry of Environment, Climate Change and Forestry mandated to mobilize, avail and manage resources for sustainable Environmental management in Kenya.

name: National Environmental Complaints Committee (NECC)
description: The National Environmental Complaints Committee (NECC) is established under Sections 31 to 36 of the Environmental Management and Co-ordination Act of 1999. Its mandate is to investigate allegations or complaints regarding the condition of the environment in Kenya, or on its own motion, suspected cases of environmental degradation. It is also mandated to undertake public interest litigation on behalf of the citizens in environmental matters.

name: National Environmental Management Authority
description: Apply for Permits and Licenses issued by National Environment Management Authority.

name: National Gender And Equality Commission
description: To promote and ensure gender equality, principles of equality and non-discrimination for all personsin Kenya as provided for in the Constitution of Kenya 2010 with a focus on the following special interest groups (SIGs): Women, persons with disability, Children, youth,older members of the society, minority and marginalised groups

name: National Government Constituency Development Fund
description:
The National Government Constituencies Development Fund (NG‐CDF) is established under the NG‐CDF
Act, 2015 (as amended in 2016).
The Fund is established with the primary objective of addressing poverty at the grassroots level and to
provide for sustainable development in all parts of the Republic pursuant to Article 10 (2) (d) of the
Constitution, by dedicating a minimum of 2.5% of the National Government Share of revenue towards
projects identified by constituencies.

name: National Health Insurance Fund (NHIF)
description: To enhance equitable and sustainable health and wellbeing of our community, cushioning them from financial hardship.

name: National Housing Development Fund
description: The National Housing Development Fund is a government initiative aimed at facilitating affordable housing for Kenyan citizens.

name: National Industrial Training Authority
description: The National Industrial Training Authority (NITA) is a state corporation established under the Industrial Training (Amendment) Act of 2011.

name: National Irrigation Authority
description: Provide and coordinate Sustainable Development and Management of irrigation services in Kenya

name: National Museums of Kenya
description: National Museums of Kenya (NMK) is a state corporation established by an Act of Parliament, the Museums and Heritage Act 2006. NMK is a multi-disciplinary institution whose role is to collect, preserve, study, document and present Kenya’s past and present cultural and natural heritage

name: National Police Service
description: Providing professional, people-centric services through upholding the rule of law for a safe society

name: National Police Service Commission
description: National Police Service Commission offers job listings and internship opportunities for Citizens to the Police Service and Secretariat

name: National Quality Control Laboratories
description: The examination and testing of drugs and any material or substance from or with which and the manner in which drugs may be manufactured, processed or treated and ensuring the quality control of drugs and medicinal substances;

name: National Registration Bureau
description: The Department of National Registration Bureau was established in 1978 to implement the Registration of Persons Act, Cap 107, laws of Kenya. The Act provides for mandatory identification, registration and issuance of identity cards to all persons who are citizens of Kenya and who have attained the age of eighteen years or over.

name: National Research Fund
description: The National Research Fund (NRF) is a Semi-Autonomous Government Agency established under the Science Technology and Innovation (ST&I) Act No. 28, Section 32 of 2013. Its mandate is to mobilize, allocate, and manage financial resources to facilitate an effective national innovation system that would create required knowledge and innovations in all fields of Science and Technology for the growing economy.

name: National Social Security Fund(NSSF)
description: The National Social Security Fund is a State Corporation that offers social protection to all workers in Kenya. The Fund provides social security protection to workers in the formal and informal sectors.

name: National Spinal Injury Referral Hospital
description: To provide acute medical intervention, rehabilitation services, reintegration and follow up of persons with spinal cord injury, and to offer promotive and preventive health services

name: National Transport And Safety Authority (NTSA) (New)
description: Dedicated platform for Application and Renewal of Driving Licence, Driving School Management and PSV related services

name: National Transport And Safety Authority (NTSA) (Old)
description: National Transport and Safety Authority Act (NTSA) is a statutory body established by the National Transport and Safety Authority Act (2012) to bring about sanity in our roads. To this end, NTSA, brings together under one roof the functions of Motor Vehicle Registration, Transport Licensing and Motor Vehicle Inspection, Road Safety, Driver Testing and some extent Traffic Law enhancement

name: National Treasury - Pensions Department
description: Pensions Department mandate is Administration and payment of pensions, death gratuities and other retirement benefits to eligible public officers and dependants; operationalization of public sector pension laws and advice on public pension policy.

name: National Water Harvesting and Storage Authority
description:
The NWHSA’s aim is to ensure that Kenya is self-sufficient and secure in terms of
water and food security through development of water infrastructure for storage,
irrigation and flood control

name: National Youth Service(NYS)
description: Its mandate is to achieve social inclusion by recruiting youth and people with disability, vulnerable and marginalized youth, female recruits, undertake socio-economic tasks of national importance, equips the youth with skills that can help them secure employment or be self-employed and increase job and training opportunities while enhancing revenue generation for the sustainability of the Service.

name: New Kenya Planters Cooperative Union
description: To provide farmers with affordable and sustainable services along the coffee value chain.

name: North Rift Valley Water Works Development Agency
description: The Mandate of NRVWWDA is to undertake the development, maintenance and management of national public water works within its area of jurisdiction as provided in the Water Act 2016. NRVWWDA operations are also guided by various other legislations among them; Constitution of Kenya 2010, State Corporations Act 2012, Environmental Management and Coordination Act 1999, among others. NRVWWDA’s region covers the Counties of Uasin Gishu, West Pokot, Turkana and Elgeyo Marakwet.

name: Numerical Machining Complex (NMC)
description: Numerical Machining Complex (NMC) is a public company owned by Kenya Railways (49%) and Kenya Shipyard Limited (51%). It specializes in mechanical engineering, offering modern facilities and skilled staff for machinery design, manufacturing, and various processes such as machining, fabrication, foundry works, heat treatment, and metallurgical analysis.

name: Nursing Council Of Kenya
description: Access NCK regulatory services for nursing and midwifery students, practitioners, training institutions, CPD providers, health facilities and others here.

name: Nyayo Tea Zones Development Corporation
description: The Corporation promotes forest conservation by providing buffer zones of tea and assorted tree species to check human encroachment into the forestland

name: Nzoia Sugar Company
description: Our  mandate is to manufacture sugar and co-products from sugarcane and establish and manage sugarcane plantations

name: Office Of The Data Protection Commissioner
description: Protect personal data in Kenya through compliance, enforcement, public awareness and institutional capacity development

name: Office of the Registrar of Political Parties
description:
The Office of the Registrar of Political Parties is committed to promote the realization of political rights through registration and regulation of political parties in Kenya.
You can now register a political party, verify your political party membership status, join a political party of choice and resign from a political party in a simple and secure way online.

name: Open University of Kenya
description: To provide affordable, flexible, quality learning experiences which enable individual acquisition of knowledge, skills and values in learners chosen fields of study; nurturing them into innovative researchers, leaders, entrepreneurs and global citizens

name: P C Kinyanjui Technical Training Institute
description: To produce innovative and industrious graduates with relevant technological knowledge and skills to fit in the labour market both locally and globally.

name: Pest Control Products Board
description: To provide effective and scientific evidence-based regulatory service and facilitate trade in pest control products in the manufacture, distribution, sale, use and disposal to ensure safety of humans, animals and the environment for a healthy and wealthy nation

name: Pharmacy And Poisons Board
description: The Board regulates the Practice of Pharmacy and the Manufacture and Trade in drugs and poisons.

name: Physiotherapy Council of Kenya
description: To have competent and ethical physiotherapy practitioners that are responsive to local and global health need

name: Policyholders Compensation Fund
description: Policyholders Compensation Fund (PCF) is a State Corporation under the National Treasury and Economic Planning that is established under Section 179 of the Insurance Act (CAP 487, Laws of Kenya) and operationalized through the Legal Notice No. 105 of 2004. The Fund was established for the primary purpose of providing compensation to claimants of an insurer that has been put under statutory management or whose license has been cancelled and for the secondary purpose of increasing the general public’s confidence in the insurance sector.

name: Power of Mercy Advisory Committee (POMAC)
description: To access end-to-end petition application for mercy

name: Private Security Regulatory Authority
description: The PSRA is a State Corporation whose mandate is to provide for a framework of regulation of the Private security Services industry and to provide a forum of cooperation between the Private Security Service industry and State Security Agencies.

name: Privatization Commission
description: To unlock the potential of public enterprises by implementing the Privatization Programme through well-designed strategies to achieve desired national objectives

name: Public Procurement Regulatory Authority
description: The Public Procurement Regulatory Authority (PPRA) is a Kenyan government agency responsible for regulating and overseeing public procurement and asset disposal processes.

name: Public Sector Accounting Standards Board
description:
The Public Sector Accounting Standards Board (PSASB) was established and constituted in accordance to sections 192 and 193 of the PFM Act, 2012 through a Gazette Notice No. 1199 of 28th February 2014.
The purpose or mandate of the Board can be summarised as follows:
Set generally accepted accounting and financial standards for the Public Sector.
Prescribe and pronounce generally accepted internal auditing standards.
Mainstreaming of best practices for good governance, internal controls and risk management in the Public Sector.

name: Public Service Commission
description: To Reform and Transform the Public Service for Efficient and Effective Service Delivery

name: Public Service Superannuation Scheme
description:
Platform for members of the Public Service Superannuation Scheme (PSSS)
to view their retirement benefits statements. Members of the PSSS
contributory pension scheme comprise of Civil Servants, Teachers employed
by Teachers Service Commission and the Disciplined Services Personnel
(National Police Service, Kenya Prisons Service and National Youth Service)

name: Public Trustee
description: The Public Trustee is a Department within the Office of the Attorney General established by the Public Trustee Act cap 168 of the laws of Kenya. The Public Trustee administers estates and trusts thereby promoting the rights of widows, widowers, orphans, people living with mental disability and other persons who are incapable of taking decisions by virtue of age or infirmity.

name: Pwani University
description: A world class university in social-economic and technological advancement

name: Pyrethrum Processing Company of Kenya
description: The Pyrethrum Industry in Kenya was regulated by the Pyrethrum Amendment Ordinance of 1938, which created the Pyrethrum Board of Kenya (PBK) which merged with the Pyrethrum Marketing Board to form one body. In partnership with Mitchell Cotts and the Commonwealth Development Corporation, PBK established the Pyrethrum Processing Company of Kenya in 1963.

name: Railway Training Institute
description: To provide education and Training for Transport and Logistics Sector

name: Registrar College Of Arms
description: The College of Arms section is under the Registrar General Department and derives its mandate from the College of Arms Act, Cap 98, Laws of Kenya. The mandate of the section is to register and grant Coat of Arms, register foreign Coat of Arms and register other armorial bearings including but not limited to flags, crests, seals, emblems, badges, uniforms, ceremonial gowns and Mace.

name: Registrar Of Cooperative Societies
description: The Registrar of Cooperative Societies of Kenya oversees the registration and regulation of cooperative societies in the country.

name: Registrar Of Marriages
description: Utilize OAG's online services for efficient marriage registration and other legal services.

name: Registrar Of Societies
description: The Registrar of Societies provides diverse digital services for efficient registration processes.

name: Registrar of Sports
description: Responsible for regulating sports organizations, professional sports bodies and professional sports persons

name: Retirement Benefits Authority (RBA)
description: Retirement Benefits Authority (RBA) is a regulatory body under the National Treasury, established under Retirement Benefits Act.

name: Rift Valley Technical Training Institute
description: Rift Valley Technical Training institute is a public technical training institute located in the highland city of Eldoret, Kenya. It is one of the Technical Training Institutes in Kenya. The institution offers Artisan, Craft, Diploma and Higher Diploma Courses with bias to practical industrial applications

name: Rivatex East Africa Limited
description: Rivatex is committed to providing quality products and services to achieve sustained, profitable growth by offering services and products which consistently satisfy the needs and expectations of its customers.

name: Rongo University
description: To provide quality and innovative higher education through teaching, research and community service

name: Rural Electrification And Renewable Energy Corporation(REREC)
description: To provide sustainable energy solutions for all through rural electrification and renewable energy for social economic transformation.

name: Sacco Societies Regulatory Authority (SASRA)
description: Access SASRA's online services for Licensed and Authorized SACCOs

name: Siaya Institute of Technology
description:
Siaya Institute of Technology is a Technical Training
Institute of Science and Technology (TVET-IST) located in Siaya Town,
Next to Siaya Medical Center, about 200 metres from The Siaya County
Referral Hospital, along Siaya-Rang'ala Road, in Siaya County, Nyanza
Region, Kenya.
We offer practical industry-based courses examined by various bodies
such as TVET-CDACC, NITA, KNEC, KASNEB and our admission series runs
annually in the months of January, May and September respectively.

name: Social Health Authority(SHA)
description: The Social Health Authority (SHA) is a State corporation under the Government of Kenya responsible for the provision and management of public health insurance within the Republic of Kenya.The core mandate of the SHA is to provide accessible, affordable, sustainable, and quality health insurance for all Kenyan citizens and, where applicable, foreign residents.

name: Sony Sugar
description: Sony Sugar provides a range of services tailored to support our diverse clients including farmers, suppliers and contractors on this platform

name: South Eastern Kenya University
description: The core mandate of the University is research, teaching and learning, community service, innovation and commercialization.

name: Special Economic Zones Authority
description: SEZA is responsible for attracting, facilitating and retaining domestic and foreign direct investments in Special Economic Zones (SEZs). The Authority serves as the regulator of both public and private SEZs in Kenya and exists to create an enabling environment for investors through the development of integrated infrastructure facilities, as well as the creation of incentives that eliminate the barriers to doing business in Eastern Africa’s most vibrant economic hub

name: Sports Arts and Social Development Fund
description: The Sports, Arts and Social Development Fund (SASDF) is established under the Public Finance Management (Sports, Arts and Social Development Fund) Regulations, 2018. The mandate of the Fund is to provide funding to support the development and promotion of sports and arts, and the promotion of social development including universal health-care

name: Sports Kenya
description:
Sports Kenya is a corporate body under the Ministry of Youth Affairs, Sports
and the Arts established by the Sports Act 2013 with the mandate of
harnessing sports development, encouraging and promoting drug free sports
and recreation, providing for establishment of sports institutions facilities,
administration and management of sports in the country and for connected
purposes.

name: State Department For Agriculture
description: The State Department of Agriculture, often a pivotal agency in each state's government, oversees policies and programs related to agriculture, farming, and rural development. Its primary role includes promoting agricultural productivity, ensuring food safety, supporting rural communities, and managing natural resources. Additionally, it may administer regulations, provide assistance to farmers, conduct research, and facilitate international trade related to agriculture.

name: State Department For Diaspora Affairs
description: To champion the welfare, rights and interests of the Kenyans in the diaspora enabling them to make competitive contributions towards national development.

name: State Department For Foreign Affairs
description: The Fourth Schedule of the Constitution of Kenya identifies Foreign Affairs and Foreign Policy as a function of the National Government. The broad mandate of the Ministry for Foreign and Diaspora Affairs is to manage Kenya’s Foreign Policy. Currently, the Ministry oversees 65 Diplomatic Missions Abroad, 2 Missions in Nairobi and 31 Honorary Consuls spread across the globe.

name: State Department For Public Works
description:
The State Department for Public Works is charged with the responsibility of Planning,
Environment and Infrastructure Development. The State Department achieves and maintains
excellence in the construction and maintenance of Public buildings and other public works.

name: State Department for Energy
description: The State Department of Energy aims to develop and implement policies that create an enabling environment for efficient operation and growth of Kenya’s energy sector. The Ministry sets strategic directions to facilitate the growth of the sector while providing long term vision for all sector players.

name: State Department for Irrigation
