description: The State Department for Irrigation was established through Executive Order No. 1 of 2023 on Organization of the Government of the Republic of Kenya. The overall mandate of the state department for irrigation is to undertake irrigation development, water harvesting and storage for irrigation and land reclamation

name: State Department for Mining
description: The mandate of the State Department includes the development of mining and mining policies, Inventory and Mapping of mineral resources and building capacity for effective management of programmes and projects in the mining sector

name: State Department for Social Protection
description: The mandate of the agency is coordinate community empowerment and promote the rights and welfare of vulnerable persons, as a fundamental part of national development through provision of child and social protection services.

name: Supplies Branch
description:
Supplies Branch is a department under the State Department for Public Works whose
mandate is to develop term contracts for common user items on behalf of Ministries,
Departments and all public institutions including schools and agencies.

name: TOURISM RESEARCH INSTITUTE
description: The object and purpose of TRI are stated in Tourism Act No. 28 of 2011. The Act states that; TRI will undertake and co-ordinate tourism research and analysis in accordance with its provisions. This will ensure that the research and knowledge gaps that exist in the sector are adequately addressed in line with the mandate of the Institute.

name: Taita Taveta University
description: Offering quality education, training, research, and outreach programs to empower communities for the improvement of their social well-being while assuring environmental sustainability.

name: Tana and Athi Rivers Development Authority
description: The Tana and Athi Rivers Development Authority (TARDA) is a State Corporation established under the Tana and Athi Rivers Development Act, CAP 443 of 1974. Its core mandate is to plan, coordinate, and implement integrated programs and projects that optimize the use of land and water resources within the Tana and Athi river basins, with the ultimate goal of empowering local communities and fostering regional development

name: Tanathi Water Work Development Agency
description: Tanathi Water Works Development Agency (TAWWDA) is a State Corporation within the Ministry of Water, Sanitation and Irrigation. The Agency develops water and sewerage infrastructure on behalf of national government in its area of jurisdiction

name: Tea Board Of Kenya
description: Access Tea Board of Kenya's online services for regulation, coordination, and promotion of tea industry development.

name: Teachers Service Commission
description: Access TSC's online services for teachers, including registration, appraisal, payslips, posting, and pension status.

name: Technical And Vocational Education And Training Authority
description: To develop a TVET system that meets national needs and aspirations

name: Technical University Of Kenya
description: To provide technological education and training and to contribute towards the advancement of society through research and innovation

name: Technical University of Mombasa
description: Our Mandate is to advance knowledge and its practical application through teaching, research and innovation to serve both industry and the community

name: Tharaka University
description: To create a strong knowledge base through teaching, research and innovation, and to disseminate this knowledge to produce all rounded graduates with problem solving skills for positive societal transformation.

name: The Co-operative University of Kenya
description: To produce competent human capital through quality education, training, research & innovation, and empower communities through outreach for socio-economic transformation.

name: The Information and Communication Technology (ICT) Authority
description: Our broad mandate entails enforcing ICT standards in Government and enhancing the supervision of its electronic communication. We also promote ICT literacy, capacity, innovation, and enterprise.

name: The Institute of Human Resource Management (IHRM)
description: The Institute of Human Resource Management (IHRM) is a Statutory Professional Body established under the Human Resource Management Professionals (HRMP) Act, No. 52 of 2012. Its mandate is to regulate the HR profession in Kenya, and enhance competencies and capabilities while supporting innovative and transformative HR practices and standards.

name: The Judiciary
description: Exprience the convinience and accessibility of Kenya's judiciary services online for efficient legal process.

name: The Kenya Accountants And Secretaries National Examinations Board
description: Transforming business professionals through Examinations, Certification, Accreditation, Research, Innovation and Consultancy

name: The Kenya Export Promotion and Branding Agency
description: The Kenya Export Promotion and Branding Agency  is a State Corporation established under the State Corporations Act Cap 446 through Legal Notice No.110 of August 9th, 2019 after the merger of the Export Promotion Council and Brand Kenya Board. The Agency's mandate is to implement export promotion and nation branding initiatives and policies to promote Kenya’s export of goods and services.

name: The Kenya Institute Of Highways and Building Technology
description: The Kenya Institute of Highways and Building Technology (KIHBT), is the training division of the Ministry Of Roads and Transport. It offers Capacity Building Courses in the Roads Sector, as well as Certificate, Diploma and Higher Diploma Courses

name: The Maasai National Polytechnic
description: The Maasai National Polytechnic is a government public Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET) institution under the Ministry of Education. It is registered to offer an array of Competency Based Education and Training (CBET) programs which are key in equipping the youth with relevant skills aligned with the industry requirements and focal to our economy.

name: The Nairobi National Polytechnic
description: The Nairobi National Polytechnic (TNNP) is a public tertiary Polytechnic under the Ministry of Education, State Department for Vocational and Technical Training.

name: The National Cancer Institute of Kenya
description: The National Cancer Institute of Kenya (NCI-Kenya) is a State Corporation established under the Cancer Prevention and Control Act (No. 15 of 2012). This was in recognition of the need for a more coordinated health sector response to the growing cancer burden in Kenya

name: The National Government Affirmative Action Fund
description: To facilitate social-economic empowerment of affirmative action groups through financial and financial and social support for inclusive and sustainable development.

name: The National Syndemic Diseases Control Council (NSDCC)
description: The Council is mandated to manage the following Syndemic diseases; HIV, sexually transmitted infections, malaria, leprosy, tuberculosis and lung disease.

name: The Postal Corporation of Kenya
description: To provide end to end, innovative, reliable, Mail, Courier, Logistics,  e- Commerce and Payment Services that delight our customers and create value to our stakeholders.

name: The President’s Award Kenya
description: The President’s Award –Kenya (PA-K) is an exciting self-development programme available to all young people countrywide equipping them with positive life skills to make a difference for themselves, their communities, country, and the world.

name: The Senate
description:
The role of the Senate includes the exercise of the legislative authority of
the Republic, manifest of the diversity of the nation, representation of the will of the
people, and exercise their sovereignty, consideration, and passing of
amendments to this Constitution, alteration of county boundaries, and protection
of the Constitution and promotion of the democratic governance of the
Republic.

name: The State Department for East African Community
description: The State Department for East African Community is charged with the responsibility of coordinating and implementing policies, strategies and programmes aimed at deepening regional integration. It formulates policy on East African Community, coordinates Government and private sector participation in the EAC Affairs, coordinates the implementation of the EAC regional programmes, coordinates the implementation of EAC Treaty and promotes and fast tracks EAC integration process.

name: The State Department for Youth Affairs and Creative Economy
description:
The State Department for Youth Affairs and Creative Economy is mandated to provide leadership, coordination, and an enabling environment for the development of youth and creatives empowerment programmes.
This programmes include Innovation, Talent and creative industry development, Youth Social development, Entrepreneurship and Skills development as well as policy, research and mainstreaming.

name: The Tourism Fund
description: Tourism Fund established to mobilize resources for Kenya's tourism industry.

name: Tom Mboya university
description: The Mandate of Tom Mboya University is to teach, train, carry out research and disseminate knowledge for the greatest benefit and wellbeing of society and by law provide for all the functions and objects of a university that are generally provided under the Universities Act 2012.

name: Tourism Promotion Fund
description:
Tourism Promotion Fund (TPF) is mandated to provide funds to support
development, promotion and branding of tourism sector in Kenya. TPF
provides funds to finance projects/ programmes through tourism
implementing Ministries, Departments and Agencies

name: Tourism Protection Service
description: An agency in the State Department For Tourism And Wildlife in the Ministry Of Tourism, Wildlife And Heritage.

name: Tourism Regulatory Authority
description: Access TRA's online services for regulated and quality tourism sector development.

name: Turkana University College
description: Welcome to the Cradle of Knowledge, a globally esteemed university in teaching, research and outreach

name: Ulinzi Health Services Fund ( UHSF)
description: Ulinzi Health Services Fund ( UHSF)  is a government-established fund that finances the provision, modernization and sustainable operation of medical and health services at Kenya Defence Forces Level IV, V and VI hospital facilities, using income from services, appropriations, grants and other lawful sources. It supports improved quality care, research, training and equipment procurement while expanding access to civilians and backing national health goals.

name: Unclaimed Financial Asset Authority
description: Our primary mandate is to receive unclaimed financial assets from the holders of such assets, safeguard and re-unite the assets with their rightful owners

name: Universities Fund
description: Our key mandate is to appoint funds to universities, Mobilize and receive funds for Universities from the government, donors and other sources, and advise the cabinet secretary on university education and related issues.

name: University Of Nairobi
description: UoN is committed to quality education through teaching, research and creative works. We are a research intensive university with a reputation for excellence and a strong and vibrant research culture.

name: University of Eldoret
description: providing quality education, training, research and consultancy in Science, Agriculture, and Technology to meet the needs and aspirations of a dynamic society

name: University of Embu
description: To generate, advance and disseminate knowledge through training, research and innovation for the development of humanity.

name: University of Kabianga
description: To create, preserve and transfer knowledge and technology through quality and entrepreneurial education, research, extension and partnership with Government, industry and non-state actors whilst ensuring a sustainable environment

name: Ushanga Kenya Initiative
description: Trasforming traditional art into tradeable commodities for significant economic and social impact

name: Uwezo Fund
description: Pioneering in financial inclusion by promoting equal and fair access to financial services for the underserved.

name: Veterinary Medicines Directorate
description:
The Veterinary Medicines Directorate (VMD) is an agency tasked with regulating the manufacture,
importation, exportation, registration, distribution, prescription and dispensing of veterinary
medicines and other animal health products in Kenya. VMD was established pursuant to CAP 366
(article 39) of the laws of Kenya

name: Water Resources Authority
description:
Water Resources Authority (WRA) regulates water
abstractions for different uses while ensuring equitable sharing. The process involves submitting an
application, giving authorization to construct abstraction works, followed by the issuance of a water
permit.

name: Water Sector Trust Fund (Water Fund)
description: Water Sector Trust Fund (WaterFund) provides conditional and unconditional grants to Counties and assists in financing the development of and management of water and sanitation services in the marginalized and underserved areas. Its mandate includes research activities in the area of water resource management and water services, sewerage and sanitation

name: Water Services Regulatory Board
description: To provide a regulatory environment that facilitates efficiency effectiveness and equity in the provision of water services in line with the human right to water and sanitation.

name: Water Works Development Agency
description: Undertake development, maintenance and management of the public water works

name: Witness Protection Agency
description: The object and purpose of the Witness Protection Agency is to provide the framework and procedures for giving special protection, on behalf of the State, to persons in possession of important information and who are facing potential risk or intimidation due to their co-operation with the prosecution and other law enforcement agencies as stated in Section 3B, Witness Protection Act.

name: Women Enterprise Fund
description: To Offer Accessible and Affordable Financial and Innovative Business Support Services to Kenyan Women for Transformed Livelihoods through Resources Mobilization, Collaborations, and Partnerships.

name: Youth Enterprise Development Fund
description: Youth Enterprise Development Fund is a state Corporation whose Mission is to increase economic opportunities for, and participation of Kenyan youth in job creation through innovative, affordable financing, enterprise development, and strategic partnerships
